question: The circular rings of muscle that are at the entrance and exit of the stomach are called.Choosing the matching term: <image 1>
description: The image depicts a microscopic view of a bacterium. The bacterium has an elongated, rod-like shape with a single, long, flagellum extending from one end. The cell body is colored in shades of pink and purple, while the flagellum is also pink but slightly lighter in color. The background is a gradient of green hues, giving the impression of a magnified view under a microscope. This type of bacterium is commonly associated with the disease cholera.
